channel.title: New Skill
channel.description: I would like to add a new skill to the skills menu. I do not need help in coding the new skill, just adding it to the array. And i do not want to replace anything there.

item.title: New Skill
item.dc:creator: @Shadowsoul Shadowsoul
item.description:
@Shadowsoul wrote:

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:18, topic:304006”][quote author=Shadowsoul link=topic=400262.msg2969589#msg2969589 date=1253853039]

So, Im guessing is your problem right now, is u cant get “new skill” to show client sided?

Yes it comes up with an error in the control panel I posted ealier what the error was.
[/quote]
Well when ur playing and u look at ur skills is “new skill” showing?[/quote]

No because when I make a new account it gives me the error on the server control panel and it doesn’t login at all.

Read full topic

item.title: New Skill
item.dc:creator: @Shadowsoul Shadowsoul
item.description:
@Shadowsoul wrote:

c19=1 c18=1 c17=1 c16=1 c15=1

e19=0 e18=0 e17=0 e16=0 e15=0

Thats where I added them.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 24, 2009, 02:49:40 pm[/size][hr]This still doesn’t work

[Error] java.lang.NumberFormatException: null
[Other] Account Created: New account
[Error] java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 18

I was guessing that command 180 I needed to change 18 to 19? And add the C19 and E19 ?

Read full topic

item.title: New Skill
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

If that character you are trying to login with was created before the updated Template, then either open it up and edit it for the new stat, or create a new character.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 24, 2009, 06:50:20 am[/size][hr]Also take a look at your command 180 in your mudclient and make sure you’ve made necessary changes there.

            if (command == 180) {
                int l2 = 1;
                for (int k10 = 0; k10 < 18; k10++) {
                    playerStatCurrent[k10] = DataOperations.getUnsignedByte(data[l2++]);
                }
                for (int i17 = 0; i17 < 18; i17++) {
                    playerStatBase[i17] = DataOperations.getUnsignedByte(data[l2++]);
                }
                for (int k21 = 0; k21 < 18; k21++) {
                    playerStatExperience[k21] = DataOperations.readInt(data, l2);
                    l2 += 4;
                }
                expGained = 0;
                return;
            }

Read full topic

item.title: New Skill
item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

Player.java as yong pointed out,

and since ur using easyrsc.

for(int i = 0;i < 18;i++) {
int exp = Integer.parseInt(props.getProperty(“e” + (i + 1)));
setExp(i, exp);
setMaxStat(i, Formulae.experienceToLevel(exp));
setCurStat(i, Integer.parseInt(props.getProperty(“c” + (i + 1))));
}

in Player.java, change the 18 at the top to 19.

Then search this:

for(int i=0; i < 18; i++) {
pr.setProperty(“c” + (i + 1), “” + this.getCurStat(i));
pr.setProperty(“e” + (i + 1), “” + this.getExp(i));
}

change the 18 to 19 again.

Then thats loading/saving done,

Template file you are gonna have to add c18=1 and e18=0

Read full topic

item.title: New Skill
item.dc:creator: @Shadowsoul Shadowsoul
item.description:
@Shadowsoul wrote:

Old Rsc Player:

Name everything u edited.

Located in mudclient:

[Code] private final String skillArrayLong[] = {“Attack”, “Defense”, “Strength”,

“Hits”, “Ranged”, “Prayer”, “Magic”, “Cooking”, “Woodcutting”, “Fletching”,

“Fishing”, “Firemaking”, “Crafting”, “Smithing”, “Mining”, “Herblaw”,

“Runecrafting”, “Thieving”, “Newskill”};[/Code]

[Code] private final String skillArray[] = {“Attack”, “Defense”, “Strength”, “Hits”,

“Ranged”, “Prayer”, “Magic”, “Cooking”, “Woodcut”, “Fletching”, “Fishing”,

“Firemaking”, “Crafting”, “Smithing”, “Mining”, “Herblaw”, “Runecrafting”,

“Thieving”, “Newskill”};[/Code]

        playerStatBase = new int[19];
        playerStatCurrent = new int[19];
        playerStatExperience = new int[19];

Located in Formulae:

public static final String[] statArray = {"attack", "defense", "strength", "hits", "ranged", "prayer", "magic", "cooking", "woodcut", "fletching", "fishing", "firemaking", "crafting", "smithing", "mining", "herblaw", "runecrafting", "thieving", "newskill"};[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 23, 2009, 10:02:11 pm[/size][hr]Oh and the new skill isn’t called “newskill” just don’t wanna give the secret away O.o

Read full topic
